Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel with pronounced band, the interior bears traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393266) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393266)
